title: Dan Gibson's Solitudes - A Celtic Christmas Story (1998)

Dan Gibson (Montreal, January 19, 1922 - March 18, 2006) was a photographer, filmmaker and Canadian soundman  the late '40s he started as a photographer and cameraman for wildlife later and produced films. television series, that way he learned to record sounds outdoors. He was a pioneer in recording techniques, even helped develop new equipment, such as "Microphone Parabolic Dan Gibson." He  In 1981 he presented as an LP some of his early recordings of the 50's and 60's, thus starting the series of albums "Solitudes". Dan Gibson's music is characterized by accompanying sounds of nature with beautiful and relaxing tunes of all time artists and New Age compositions.  Dan Gibson's music is characterized by accompanying sounds of nature with beautiful and relaxing tunes of all time.
